name: Markus Strickert
label: Consultant - Sigma Technology
summary: I have a background as a system verification engineer, testing and validating systems across hardware, firmware, and software from early development to delivery. I design and automate tests, have hands on lab experience, and handle verification and requirements documentation. I have a background in astrophysics and scientific computing. A strong analytical mindset, problem solving and collaboration in agile teams are key assets in my everyday work.

highlights: Programming & automation: NI Teststand and MAX

work_experience.summary: Two years of experience in system verification and testing across software and hardware, gaining solid system‑level understanding through hands‑on integration, commissioning, and verification work. I have participated in customer interactions, formal system analyses, and FMV demonstrations as system test responsible, coordinating activities and managing security‑classified equipment. I have taken on team‑lead duties, run agile retrospectives, and produced technical documentation used across multiple teams. My work includes requirements and test specification management, simulator improvements, and test automation in C++ and Python, alongside quality assurance and structured handling of secure information.
highlights: Requirements and test specifications: DOORS NG
Programming & automation: C++, Python, Bash, CLI
Work methodology: Agile workflows using JIRA
Standards: Work in accordance with military standards
Test & verification: Hardware and firmware testing in laboratory environments, software testing against hardware

work_experience.summary: After my Master’s degree, I was selected for one of 13 projects at Leiden Observatory from over 500 applicants, where I worked on star–planet interaction modeling using 3D MHD simulations and data analysis. The project resulted in a publication and required structured, independent work with complex systems. I improved existing simulation tools in Fortran, developed analysis and processing workflows in Python, and handled large scale datasets with version control in Git. I regularly communicated results to technical and cross disciplinary audiences at national and international events. The work strengthened my ability to deliver high quality technical output, ranging from method development and verification to clear documentation—and led to a nomination to a Caltech Think Tank on future space mission concepts
highlights: Programming: Python, Fortran, Bash, AWK, Linux
Data Analysis & Visualization: Python, PyTecplot, Tecplot (2D/3D, animations)
Simulation & Computation: Large-scale simulations on supercomputers (HPC, Snellius)
Work Methodology: Git, method development, structured documentation, LaTeX, VS Code
Presentation: Technical presentations for expert and decision-making audiences
